nodes.bodyText: Do the corresponding page stores need to handle InterruptedException? For example, LocalPageStore will throw an IOException if it catches any exception, so we will not see TimeoutException?

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -962,6 +962,24 @@ public MetricKey build() {
           .setMetricType(MetricType.COUNTER)
           .setIsClusterAggregated(false)
           .build();
+  public static final MetricKey CLIENT_CACHE_STORE_DELETE_TIMEOUT =
+      new Builder(Name.CLIENT_CACHE_STORE_DELETE_TIMEOUT)
+          .setDescription("Number of timeouts when writing new pages to page store.")

@@ -962,6 +962,24 @@ public MetricKey build() {
           .setMetricType(MetricType.COUNTER)
           .setIsClusterAggregated(false)
           .build();
+  public static final MetricKey CLIENT_CACHE_STORE_DELETE_TIMEOUT =
+      new Builder(Name.CLIENT_CACHE_STORE_DELETE_TIMEOUT)
+          .setDescription("Number of timeouts when writing new pages to page store.")
+          .setMetricType(MetricType.COUNTER)
+          .setIsClusterAggregated(false)
+          .build();
+  public static final MetricKey CLIENT_CACHE_STORE_GET_TIMEOUT =
+      new Builder(Name.CLIENT_CACHE_STORE_GET_TIMEOUT)
+          .setDescription("Number of timeouts when writing new pages to page store.")

nodes.bodyText: operations? Which operations are affected? Also, is there a setting that disables the timeout?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3648,6 +3648,12 @@ public String toString() {
           .setConsistencyCheckLevel(ConsistencyCheckLevel.WARN)
           .setScope(Scope.CLIENT)
           .build();
+  public static final PropertyKey USER_CLIENT_CACHE_STORE_TIMEOUT =
+      new Builder(Name.USER_CLIENT_CACHE_STORE_TIMEOUT)
+          .setDescription("The timeout for page store options")

nodes.bodyText: Is there a way to create a threadpool that can have named threads? Does the threadpool ever have to be shutdown at the end?
will this test take 10s? That seems too long? Would a timeout like 1s be good enough?

nodes.bodyText: would it be easier to just have a timeout of -1 represent disabled, instead of 2 consistent parameters?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3648,6 +3648,33 @@ public String toString() {
           .setConsistencyCheckLevel(ConsistencyCheckLevel.WARN)
           .setScope(Scope.CLIENT)
           .build();
+  public static final PropertyKey USER_CLIENT_CACHE_TIMEOUT_DURATION =
+      new Builder(Name.USER_CLIENT_CACHE_TIMEOUT_DURATION)
+          .setDefaultValue("60sec")
+          .setDescription("The timeout duration for local I/O operations on "
+              + "reading/writing/deleting in the cache. Local cache operations that time out will "
+              + "fail and fallback to external file system.")
+          .setConsistencyCheckLevel(ConsistencyCheckLevel.WARN)
+          .setScope(Scope.CLIENT)
+          .build();
+  public static final PropertyKey USER_CLIENT_CACHE_TIMEOUT_ENABLED =
+      new Builder(Name.USER_CLIENT_CACHE_TIMEOUT_ENABLED)
